author: sky.cactus
content:
Ended up super busy today, so probably won't get 2718 updated until tomorrow.  Tentative plane:
* Split the EIP in two, one for the new transaction/receipt formats and one for the new legacy wrapper transaction type.
* Remove everything about deprecation of the legacy format from the EIP.
* Extract the devp2p changes into their own EIP with improved definitions that better align with reality.
* Change transaction/receipt root merkle path back to an RLP encoded integer
* Create EIP for JSON-RPC endpoints for new transaction format (naming welcome)
* Update EIP-2930 to be in line with latest iteration of 2718
* Update EIP-2711 to be in line with latest iteration of 2718 (and potentially revamp it with help from <@!425279588009246720>)

author: lightclient
content: were we wanting EIP-2718 to introduce a replacement for the legacy tx format? e.g. the exact same except its tx type is prepended to RLP encoded tx before hashing

author: lightclient
content: i believe this would allow future wallets to disregard the legacy hashing format completely

author: pipermerriam
content: If possible I believe we should aim for eventually depreciation of the current/legacy format. Likely on a longish timeline after eip-2718 is live to give time for the many many many things that will need to be updated. I've been considering something like a time bomb that slowly ratchets up the intrinsic transaction cost over the course of 18 months to ensure nobody is still using it at the point of full  depreciation
